subject: Greetings
body:
Greetings
I have been waiting to hear from you.
Best Regards,
--
Hon. Kwami Emmanuel Kpondzo
Senior Attorney,
Kpondzo & Co Chambers

subject: Re: Greetings
body:
Hello Hon. Kwami Emmanuel Kpondzo,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm curious to know what information you would like to share with me. Please go ahead and let me know what you have in mind.

Best wishes,
Alan

subject: Re: Greetings ..
body:
Greetings Alan,

Thank you for your mail?  From the turn of your letter to me I discovered
that you didn't receive letter which I sent to you few days ago,  I am
re-sending my message to you which I sent to you 7 days ago, with due
respect, I am Barrister Kwami Emmanuel Kpondzo, A legal adviser /financial
consultant to the late Mr. George, who worked here in Lome-Togo in West
Africa as a contractor. He died few years ago as a result of a ghastly
accident here in Togo and since then his bank account has been dormant
without a claim, recently the management of his bank called and issued me a
one-month ultimatum to provide his relative that can stand as his
beneficiary /next of kin to claim his sum of Nine million six hundred
thousand United State dollars ($9.6 million USD) or they will have the fund
confiscated into their government treasury as unclaimed fund. As the legal
adviser /financial consultant to late Mr. George, I seek your honest
Co-operation to present you to the bank based on your similarity of country
and family name with him, to act as his relative /next of kin, in order to
ascertain approval and release of his balance of ($9.6 million USD) as it
was stipulated in banks and allied matters of the federal republic of Togo,
so as not to allow the bank confiscate the fund as unclaimed. I will be
honored to have you here in Lome-Togo as to present you to the bank in
person to facilitate all the processes and also to make every step appear
clear and transparent to you and to everyone, But if you can't come to Togo
then I will have to apply formally to the bank on your behalf so that they
can process the application for the release and transfer of the deposited
funds to you because the money will be deposited in your personal account
as the bonafide beneficiary /next of kin to the deceased then after which
we can discuss how and what ratio to share the money.

Further information shall be relayed to you upon your positive response.

Kind Regards,

Barrister Kwami Emmanuel Kpondzo Esq
Solicitors & Advocates / Principal Attorney Kpondzo & Co. Chambers.
A: Public Notary, Lome, Togo, West Africa
Whats-app +22899285661

subject: Re: Greetings ..
body:
Hello Barrister Kwami Emmanuel Kpondzo,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I apologize if I missed your previous letter, but I'm glad you followed up. The situation you described regarding the late Mr. George sounds quite unfortunate.

I must admit, I am not familiar with banking procedures and legal matters, so I have a few questions. Firstly, could you please provide more details about the bank and its requirements for claiming the funds? It would be helpful to understand the process better.

Additionally, you mentioned that if I am unable to come to Togo, you can apply formally on my behalf. How does that work? What information would you need from me in order to proceed with the application?

Lastly, once the funds are released, as you mentioned we can discuss how to share them. Could you please elaborate on what ratio or arrangement is typically made in such cases?

Thank you again for contacting me and providing this opportunity. I look forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Alan

subject: Re: More information..
body:
Greetings Alan,

Thank you for your mail, Alan, I want you to know that it was not by
mistake that I contacted you, I did because I was left with no other option
than this. Firstly, I would like to notify you that I am soliciting for
your total assistance and co-operation to enable the bank to release the
sum of (US$9.6 Million) balance of my Late client, to your account. This
transaction is guided under the Parliamentary ACTS and Inheritance By-Laws
of this country as enacted on the 18th of October 1992 under the
supervision of the house of parliament. The transaction is therefore 100%
legal without any risks at all, in as much as we followed the laid down
procedures as enacted by law.

Alan, I would also like to bring to your notice that although I have
contacted you based on a name similarity and basis. Such a basis for
inheritance claims as enshrined in the national allied banking matters act
of Republic of Togo 1990 as amended in 1996 ,qualifies you for outright
participation in the claim's payment procedure as far as I can back you up
with legal court paperwork. So, bear it in mind that it is for the mutual
benefit of our both families and that is where I stand. Once again,I thank
you for your time and concern. Basically, what we are supposed to do now is
for the two of us to cooperate and get the money from the bank. They are
willing to pay as long as the process remains legal.

This business/transaction will be handled legitimately conforming to all
acceptable international standards, let is be mentioned for the sake of
records that this our mutual benefit transaction is absolutely legitimate
as all the necessary documents that will be needed in a transaction of this
nature and volume of funds will be issued and obtained in your name and
favour as the bona fide beneficiary/next of kin.

Alan, my duty as a lawyer is to serve my clients and provide them with
background coverage of the laws and governing acts and edicts both
parliamentary acts and by-laws or notary publications. So I provide all
legal services covering financial trading and protective stock brokerage
within the frames of the modus operandi of the National Allied banking and
financial matters acts of this country. Also a bit of International Law but
I am more of an advocate and representative within the jurisdictional
entity of the Customary and Federal High Courts.I am your lawyer in this
claim and it is one of my duties to protect you from any action that will
not favour the two of us because we stand for one thing together and that
is the motive to receive the fund.

As well it is very important that you note here that what you are doing is
an international bank transaction which involves cash and I mean huge sum.
Banks these days are mandated by laws to forward or record any transaction
that involves a certain amount of money moving out of the country. Most of
these laws exist in every country. So if you understand this fact which is
also operational even in the United States, as certain amounts of money
involved in transactions are reported for verification and sources of the
money, then if you understand this, you will be able to grasp what I am
about to explain to you now. I do not respond to your mail from my own
points of view, I rather base it on facts obtainable both in the banking
industry here and around the world as well as all legal methods necessary
for our case.

Now first and foremost, I want you to realize that everyday funds are being
transferred in and out of a country, based on the amounts involved, some
funds may even pass through the office of the presidency before being
approved for transfer to an individual or organization. This is not
something strange or new, it is a daily banking activity. The laws have
been there and they guide banking activities. So understand this issue,
 what we are doing is an inheritance claim and normally as stipulated by
the Allied banking matters act and in compliance with the same
constitutional provisions, Inheritance issues in Lome Togo are dealt with
by the Probate Registry, which is a division of the High Court. Its
jurisdiction extends to all property of the deceased situated in Lome Togo
as at the date of his/her death. In a case of death by intestacy as ours
is, the court will require his lawyer or a qualified practitioner in the
relevant jurisdiction to introduce his supposed next of kin who will be
approved normally by affidavits of fact issued by the Inland Revenue
Commissioner to inherit the funds. This is where I will come in and submit
your information. All requirements in this transaction are applicable by
law. The bank is legally supported by the Inheritance constitution in
demand for certain Court documents from you as backup evidence of your
claims for the fund payment. These documents are evidential and provisional
Writs of the Court which authenticates your claims and legally empowers you
with rights over the ownership of the funds with BSIC Lomé-Togo. The
documents vary from bank to bank. A bank may demand for documents according
to its operational guidelines and another can demand according to banking
laws, if we procure and tender legal documents which will bear your name
officially, and legally certify you as the bonafide beneficiary, there is
no agency or authority in the world that can question you at all. You can
never face any problem for an inherited money with your government as the
court documents will be coming with, A COURT WRIT OF MANDAMUS (AN OFFICIAL
ORDER FROM THE COURT TO A LOWER AUTHORITY OR ORGANIZATION TO CARRY OUT AN
ACTION. A WRITTEN PROOF FROM A COMPETENT COURT OF JURISDICTION, STATING
THAT ONE HAS THE TRUE INTENT OF CARRYING OUT ANY ACT AS FAR AS IT IS LAW
ABIDING) SO NO AUTHORITY OR ORGANIZATION HAS RIGHT TO QUESTION COURT ORDER,
All authorities both here and in your country cannot in any way issue a
query to you, So it is very important that you follow every lay down
directives.

Just a tip-: Inheritance issues in Lome Togo are dealt with by the Probate
Registry, which is a division of the High Court. Its jurisdiction extends
to all property of the deceased situated in Lome Togo as at the date of
his/her death. In a case of death by intestacy as ours is, the court will
require his lawyer or a qualified practitioner in the relevant jurisdiction
to introduce his supposed next of kin who will be approved normally by
affidavits of fact issued by the Inland Revenue Commissioner to inherit the
funds. This is where I will come in and submit your information.

Please understand this, if the dead person, Late Mr. George , has no WILL
and testament, the estate is dealt with according to the rules of
intestacy'. These set out exactly who is entitled to what, starting with
anybody (or civil partner). If someone dies intestate they have died
without leaving instructions about who should receive their property, many
people die intestate because they thought they were too young to make a
WILL, if a person dies intestate, the sole executors decides how the money
is shared out among the families.

In your case, Late Mr. George, died intestate without leaving WILL
instructions about who should receive his property, so this gives you the
authority to deal with the estate - collecting in all the deceased's
assets, paying off any debts and tax liabilities, and ultimately
distributing the assets to yourself and any other beneficiaries according
to the rules of intestacy.

Bear in mind that it is up to the executors or administrators to ensure
that you each get what you are entitled to under the terms of the 'rules of
intestacy'. In addition, any reliable succession has a right in the
deceased property if the man dies intestate.  So I will like to clarify
this and make it known to you outright that I am the sole executor to the
funds and I was privy to all his financial dealings with the bank, hence I
have been mandated by the bank to present an heir, having been demanding
for this for over two years plus and since the bank has given me a mandate
to present an heir, within the next 21 days as stipulated by law, I am here
presenting you with this golden opportunity. I alone have the right to tell
the bank and every concerned authority that you are the legal beneficiary.
It's my duty and not yours. Your duty is to lay claim to the fund and my
duty is to back your claims up.

Alan, you need to know what is required of us now to get your name
certified and approved as the next of kin and beneficiary to the fund, we
shall provide court inheritance documents in your name, These documents can
only be procured at the Ministry of Justice in the High Court of Togo.
Those are very delicate and important court documents. The documents are
officially needed to exhibit the act ( section 2- sub-section 94) of the
financial and allied matters of 1993 of this great institute, and to enable
the payee bank to ensure that the estate of my late client is transferred
to the authorized beneficiary. Alan, you have to produce a court backing
for such claims and without which you even have no claims at all because
the Court is the Highest Arm of Authority here and the decisions of the
Court is not questioned; I am certain of the documents in your name as your
lawyer is my duty to back you up in the court. Banks prefer to work with
legal clients because they believe that the Court will not send a criminal
to them. So if the Court grants you the documents and you send them to the
bank, my dear you will hug me and congratulate me for this success.

So, there will be about 3 or 4 court inheritance documents which we will
procure in your name, very important, there is never anywhere in the world
government can issue you such power of documents to claim US$9.6 Million
without you paying the stamp duty fees, registration fee and Tax/VAT on
those documents, so this is normal inheritance procedure to prove the
source of the fund, the United States and world against funding for
terrorism and so many embargoes that are placed daily. I know you are a
mature adult, well educated. So I expect you to understand this. Honestly,
I will tell you the trust the way it's, we need to obtain and register your
name with a court inheritance document, so those documents are not for free.

Honestly, I will be honored to have you here in Lome-Togo as to present you
to the bank in person to facilitate all the processes and also to make
every step appear clear and transparent to you and to everyone to enable
you witness the whole process and watch us move step by step to achieve the
success of this fund transfer, But if you can't come to Togo then I will
have to apply formally to the bank on your behalf so that they can process
the application for the release and transfer of the deposited funds to you
as the bonafide beneficiary /next of kin to the deceased then after which
we can discuss how and what ratio to share the money.

I will announce the beneficiary to the Late Mr. George estate, we need a
Letter of Administration in your name and information from Lome High Court,
Letters of Administration in probate are the documents that allow the
necessary legal processes to start. Probate refers to the practice of
administering an estate after someone dies; if the deceased person did not
have a Will, probate cannot begin without court approval. This approval is
granted in the form of a Letter of Administration.

Letter of administration is the legal authority by the probate Court to a
person called the administrator or administratrix to administer the estate
or property of a person who died intestate. A person is said to have died
intestate when he dies without leaving behind a valid will. The
administrator derives his or her authority to act from the terms of the
letter of administration, and where the letter of administration is not
granted, an administrator lacks the authority to act. It is instructive to
note that while a probate merely confirms the authority of an executor, a
letter of administration confers authority on an administrator.

So, customarily, the person granted the letter of administration is called
administrator or administratrix  if female. So the Letters of
Administration are the first step within the probate process. Without this
document, you will likely be unable to conduct all of the tasks necessary
to move through probate and ultimately settle an Estate. So please, you
need to come down here.

1. Seven days Tourist Visa will be issued to you at the port of entry here
in Lomé–Tokoin Airport, also known as Gnassingbé Eyadéma International
Airport Lome Togo. You will be issued with a 7 days tourist Visa on
arrival. While your stay here will not take more than 3 working days as
such you are advised to schedule your flight booking to tally with a 3 days
return ticket to enable you to face business appointments you might have
back home. You will be guided and assisted on Visa processing upon your
arrival because I will make contact with a customs officer who will stamp
you in at the port of entry.

2. I will need a complete flight schedule ticket which will indicate your
arrival date and time to enable me to be at the airport and pick you on
arrival.

3. You need to make a hotel reservation before your departure from your
country. It is a mandatory requirement for issuance of a tourist Visa at
the point of arrival. I will reach you with the most suitable hotel name
and location to enable you to make such a reservation once I have your
information.

4. I must formally apply to the bank on your behalf presenting you to the
bank as the next of kin to my late client, since the bank has given me a
mandate to present an heir, within the next 21 days as stipulated by law,
so I need to register your name and information with the bank before your
arrival and to enable me find out the requirements and documents to
procured from the Lome jurisdictional Federal high court in your name.

To apply formally and fill the claim application form at the bank on your
behalf you are required to confirm the following information:

FIRST NAME:
LAST NAME:
ADDRESS:
COUNTRY:
NATIONALITY:
OCCUPATION:
MARITAL STATUS:
AGE:
TELEPHONE/WHATS-APP No:

I propose that the sharing mode of the funds will be as follows: 45% to you
for your part in this transaction for standing as the next of kin to my
deceased client, and 45% for me, while the remaining 10% will be Alanated
to the Charity homes around the world. But if you feel otherwise, do not
hesitate to notify me. I have taken time to explain the process for you to
understand there is no atom of risk involved in this transaction. My major
concern is that you in return should not double-cross me at the conclusion
of this transaction.

Please note that this transaction requires utmost trust, sincerity and
confidentiality for its conclusion. You can call or add me on whats-app on
this number +22899285661 for more information.

Kind Regards,

Barrister Kwami Emmanuel Kpondzo Esq
Solicitors & Advocates / Principal Attorney Kpondzo & Co. Chambers.
A: Public Notary, Lome, Togo, West Africa
Whats-app +22899285661

subject: Re: More information..
body:
Hello Barrister Kwami Emmanuel Kpondzo Esq,

Thank you for reaching out to me and providing all this information. I appreciate your thorough explanation of the legal process involved in claiming the funds. It seems like a complex procedure, but I'm willing to learn more and cooperate with you.

I understand that obtaining the necessary court documents is crucial for this claim. Could you please explain in more detail what these documents are and how they will prove my eligibility as the next of kin? Also, what specific steps do we need to take to ensure that the bank releases the funds?

Additionally, you mentioned that there are fees associated with procuring these documents. Could you please clarify what these fees are for and how much they amount to? I want to make sure I have a clear understanding of all the financial aspects involved.

Thank you once again for your time and assistance.

Best wishes,
Alan

subject: Re: More clarification ..
body:
Hello  Alan,

Thank you for your swift response, I think you didn't take your time and
read my message very well, I will repeat to enable you to understand
now. Those documents can only be procured at the Ministry of Justice in the
High Court of Togo here. Those are very delicate and important court
documents. The documents are officially needed to exhibit the act ( section
2- sub-section 94) of the financial and allied matters of 1993 of this
great institute, and to enable the payee bank to ensure that the estate of
my late client is transferred to the authorized beneficiary.   In a case of
death by intestacy as ours is, the court will require his lawyer or a
qualified practitioner in the relevant jurisdiction to introduce his
supposed next of kin who will be approved normally by affidavits of fact
issued by the Inland Revenue Commissioner to inherit the funds. This is
where I will come in and submit your information, because the BSIC bank is
legally supported by the Inheritance constitution in demand for Court
documents from you as backup evidence of your claims for the fund payment.
These documents are evidential and provisional Writs of the Court which
authenticates your claims and legally empowers you with rights over the
ownership of the funds with BSIC Lomé-Togo. The documents vary from bank to
bank. A bank may demand for documents according to its operational
guidelines and another can demand according to banking laws. Mr. George ,
died intestate without leaving WILL instructions about who should receive
his property, so this gives you the authority to deal with the estate -
collecting in all the deceased's assets, paying off any debts and tax
liabilities and ultimately distributing the assets to yourself and any
other beneficiaries according to the rules of intestacy. When a person dies
intestate, If there is no will to go by, a state probate court will
determine how the person’s estate will be distributed. That's why we are
going through court to obtain all the inheritance documents in your name.

Note: These court inheritance documents will cost you £ 7,600 GBP
equivalent so as you are coming you will come down here in person with the
cash of  £ 7,600 GBP and we will move to court together for the
procurement of those inheritance documents in your name. The fee is for
stamp duty and tax/Vat and registration of those 3 powerful inheritance
documents in your name.

So please, you need to book your flight now for your arrival here in the
next 7 days from today.

Kind Regards,

Barrister Kwami Emmanuel Kpondzo Esq
Solicitors & Advocates / Principal Attorney Kpondzo & Co. Chambers.
A: Public Notary, Lome, Togo, West Africa
Whats-app +22899285661

subject: Re: More clarification ..
body:
Hello Barrister Kwami Emmanuel Kpondzo Esq,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I apologize if I misunderstood your previous message. It seems like obtaining these court documents is a crucial step in order to proceed with the fund payment. I appreciate you clarifying that the documents vary from bank to bank and that they are necessary to provide evidence of my claims.

I understand that Mr. George passed away without leaving a will, which gives me the opportunity to deal with his estate and assets. It's interesting to learn about the rules of intestacy and how the state probate court determines how the person's estate will be distributed.

Regarding the fee for stamp duty, tax VAT, and obtaining these powerful documents in my name, could you please provide more details? How much would this fee amount to? And what is the process for making this payment?

Also, I would like to know if there are any specific requirements or documents I need to prepare before booking my flight and arriving in Togo. It would be helpful to have a clear understanding of what is expected of me during this process.

Thank you once again for your assistance.

Best wishes,
Alan

subject: Re: Note..
body:
Hello Alan,

Thank you, I will answer you one by one.

"I understand that Mr. George passed away without leaving a will, which
gives me the opportunity to deal with his estate and assets. It's
interesting to learn about the rules of intestacy and how the state probate
court determines how the person's estate will be distributed."

Answer: By issuing you those inheritance documents which will empower you
over the ownership of the fund with the BSIC bank.

"Regarding the fee for stamp duty, tax VAT, and obtaining these powerful
documents in my name, could you please provide more details? How much would
this fee amount to? And what is the process for making this payment?"

Answer:  as soon as you come down here in person, I will take you to court
for the procurement of those document and you will witness everything
yourself and the cost of obtaining those inheritance court documents in
your name is £ 7,600 GBP equivalent, which included with the registration
fee, stamp duty and  tax/VAT,so the total fee is £ 7,600 GBP

"Also, I would like to know if there are any specific requirements or
documents I need to prepare before booking my flight and arriving in Togo.
It would be helpful to have a clear understanding of what is expected of me
during this process."

Answer: YES, the information below.

FIRST NAME:
LAST NAME:
ADDRESS:
COUNTRY:
NATIONALITY:
OCCUPATION:
MARITAL STATUS:
AGE:
TELEPHONE/WHATS-APP No:

To apply formally and fill the claim application form at the bank on your
behalf before your arrival here.

Kind Regards,

Barrister Kwami Emmanuel Kpondzo Esq
Solicitors & Advocates / Principal Attorney Kpondzo & Co. Chambers.
A: Public Notary, Lome, Togo, West Africa
Whats-app +22899285661

subject: Re: Your mail.
body:
Hello Alan,

I am still waiting?

Kind Regards,

Barrister Kwami Emmanuel Kpondzo Esq
Solicitors & Advocates / Principal Attorney Kpondzo & Co. Chambers.
A: Public Notary, Lome, Togo, West Africa
Whats-app +22899285661

subject: Re: Your mail.
body:
Hello Barrister Kwami Emmanuel Kpondzo Esq,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I apologize if there has been any delay in my response. How can I assist you today?

Best wishes,
Alan
